main event: There were multiple UFO sightings at Gander AFB, Newfoundland between 1957 and 1958, involving observations by military personnel, tracking by radar, and visual sightings of oval-shaped, windowed objects moving at high speeds and making sharp turns.
interesting points: Multiple reports indicated sightings of oval-shaped objects with portholes or windows around the circumference, which hovered motionless before departing at high speeds.
The objects were observed to be luminous and stood out in sharp contrast against the dark clouds in the sky.
One observation report described the object as a flashing light maneuvering in a patterned way, with estimated dimensions of 40ft length and 20ft width, and traveling at speeds between 300-600 mph.
Investigating officers concluded that the incidents were completely unexplained and did not resemble any known aircraft, missile, or satellite.

There were simultaneous radar and visual observations of objects moving at high speeds and making sharp turns, with conclusions indicating that the objects were possibly balloons, aircraft, astronomical, or of foreign air origin.
witnesses: USAF personnel and AGC crew members
